lst.name: sentence
lst.str: But it is much too early to predict whether other exchanges can inflict serious damage on the Comex' daily trading volume of more than 40,000 contracts which represents commitments to buy and sell gold of more than 2 billion dlrs.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: CDT), it will go toe-to-toe in an uphill battle against the Commodity Exchange Inc. of New York (Comex), which brokerage executives describe as the world's precious metals futures capital for institutional business.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: "The Merc's gold futures would be insurance for dealers, merchants and customers that there would be a market open for trading," if heavy gold or silver futures volume causes the Comex to close early again, said Jack Lehman, senior vice president and director of commodities for Shearson Lehman Bros.
